introText: Conversation around M.O.M. briefly spiked across general comics spaces at launch, drawing both comics regulars and Emilia Clarke fans, with mixed sentiment and no enduring dedicated hub.

platforms.name: Reddit
platforms.description: Debates in major subreddits (e.g., r/comicbooks) centered on previews and issue #1; sentiment skewed mixed-to-negative with sporadic mentions afterward.

platforms.name: ComicsHeatingUp Forum
platforms.description: Speculators weighed potential media options and collector value; reactions split from early dismissals to later positive surprise, with coordination around signed editions.

platforms.name: Goodreads
platforms.description: Functioned as a review-driven micro-forum where new readers and comics veterans exchanged impressions; some author questions appeared without official replies.

platforms.name: Telegram (Spanish comics channel)
platforms.description: Niche international chatter tied to the Spanish release; modest attention on posts discussing the translation.

quote.text: The art is great... The story was a bit hard to follow
quote.author: Reddit user

closingText: Overall, activity formed in small, loosely connected pockets with brief cross-talk between celebrity fandom and comics communities, then tapered without a lasting home base.
